agriculture.title: Agriculture
agriculture.description: "Oh farmers, pray that your summers be wet and your winters clear." - Virgil

alphabet.title: Alphabet
alphabet.description: "Words have the power to both destroy and heal. When words are both true and kind, they can change our world." - The Buddha

animal_husbandry.title: Animal Husbandry
animal_husbandry.description: "Blessed shall be the fruit of thy cattle, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep." - The Bible, Deut. 28:4

archery.title: Archery
archery.description: "Do not throw the arrow which will return against you." - Kurdish Proverb

artillery.title: Artillery
artillery.description: "Artillery adds dignity to what would otherwise be a vulgar brawl." - Frederick the Great

assembly_line.title: Assembly Line
assembly_line.description: "People can have the Model T in any color - so long as it's black." - Henry Ford

astronomy.title: Astronomy
astronomy.description: "Astronomy compels the soul to look upwards and leads us from this world to another." - Plato

banking.title: Banking
banking.description: "Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies." - Thomas Jefferson

biology.title: Biology
biology.description: "It is not the strongest of the species that survive, but the one most responsive to change." - Charles Darwin

bronze_working.title: Bronze Working
bronze_working.description: "It is entirely seemly for a young man killed in battle to lie mangled by the bronze spear. In his death all things appear fair." - Homer

calendar.title: Calendar
calendar.description: "For everything there is a season and a time for every purpose under heaven." - Ecclesiastes

chemistry.title: Chemistry
chemistry.description: "Chemistry means the difference between poverty and starvation and the abundant life." - Robert Brent

civil_service.title: Civil Service
civil_service.description: "The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy" - Unknown

code_of_laws.title: Code of Laws
code_of_laws.description: "To bring about the rule of righteousness in the land, so that the strong should not harm the weak." - Hammurabi's Code; Prologue

combustion.title: Combustion
combustion.description: "Everything in life is somewhere else, and you get there in a car." - E. B. White

communism.title: Communism
communism.description: "When I give food to the poor, they call me a saint. When I ask why the poor have no food, they call me a communist." - Dom Helder Camara

compass.title: Compass
compass.description: "The wisest men follow their own direction." - Euripides

composites.title: Composites
composites.description: "The whole is greater than the sum of its parts." - Aristotle

computers.title: Computers
computers.description: "Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window." - Steve Wozniak

constitution.title: Constitution
constitution.description: "No freeman shall be taken, imprisoned, or in any other way destroyed, except by the lawful judgment of his peers." - The Magna Carta

construction.title: Construction
construction.description: "And on the pedestal these words appear: 'My name is Ozymandias, king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!' Nothing beside remains." - Percy Bysshe Shelley

corporation.title: Corporation
corporation.description: "Corporation, n. An ingenious device for obtaining individual profit without individual responsibility." - Ambrose Bierce

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: "Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it." - Publius Syrus

democracy.title: Democracy
democracy.description: "It has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all the others that have been tried." - Winston Churchill

drama.title: Drama
drama.description: "All the world's a stage, And all the men and women merely players. They have their exits and their entrances; And one man in his time plays many parts. " - William Shakespeare

ecology.title: Ecology
ecology.description: "We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors, we borrow it from our children" - Native American Song

economics.title: Economics
economics.description: "Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe." - Albert Einstein

education.title: Education
education.description: "There is no wealth like knowledge, no poverty like ignorance." - Ali ibn Abi-Talib

electricity.title: Electricity
electricity.description: "We will make electricity so cheap that only the rich will burn candles." - Thomas Edison

engineering.title: Engineering
engineering.description: "A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away." - Antoine de Saint-Exupry

fascism.title: Fascism
fascism.description: "The great masses of the people... will more easily fall victims to a big lie than to a small one." - Adolf Hitler

feudalism.title: Feudalism
feudalism.description: "I will to my lord be true and faithful, and love all which he loves and shun all which he shuns." - Anglo Saxon Oath of Fealty

fiber_optics.title: Fiber Optics
fiber_optics.description: "There is a single light of science, and to brighten it anywhere is to brighten it everywhere." - Isaac Asimov

fishing.title: Fishing
fishing.description: "Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime." - Lao Tzu

fission.title: Fission
fission.description: "If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst at once into the sky, that would be like the splendor of the Mighty One... I am become Death, the Shatterer of Worlds." - J. Robert Oppenheimer, quoting "The Bhagavad Gita"

flight.title: Flight
flight.description: "For once you have tasted flight you will walk the earth with your eyes turned skywards, for there you have been and there you will long to return." - Leonardo Da Vinci

fusion.title: Fusion
fusion.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." - Arthur C. Clarke

future_tech.title: Future Tech
future_tech.description: "The future will be better tomorrow." - Dan Quayle

genetics.title: Genetics
genetics.description: "Soon it will be a sin for parents to have a child which carries the heavy burden of genetic disease." - Bob Edwards

guilds.title: Guilds
guilds.description: "People of the same trade seldom meet together, even for merriment and diversion, but the conversation ends in a conspiracy against the public." - Adam Smith

gunpowder.title: Gunpowder
gunpowder.description: "You can get more of what you want with a kind word and a gun than you can with just a kind word." - Al Capone

horseback_riding.title: Horseback Riding
horseback_riding.description: "If you speak the truth, have a foot in the stirrup." - Turkish proverb

hunting.title: Hunting
hunting.description: "If you chase two rabbits, you will lose them both." - Native American Saying

industrialism.title: Industrialism
industrialism.description: "There is one rule for the industrialist and that is: Make the best quality of goods possible at the lowest cost possible, paying the highest wages possible." - Henry Ford

iron_working.title: Iron Working
iron_working.description: "You should hammer your iron when it is glowing hot." - Publius Syrus

liberalism.title: Liberalism
liberalism.description: "Any society that would give up a little liberty to gain a little security will deserve neither and lose both." - Benjamin Franklin

literature.title: Literature
literature.description: "Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested." - Sir Francis Bacon

masonry.title: Masonry
masonry.description: "It is from their foes, not their friends, that cities learn the lesson of building high walls." - Aristophanes

mass_media.title: Mass Media
mass_media.description: "The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about." - Oscar Wilde

mathematics.title: Mathematics
mathematics.description: "If in other sciences we should arrive at certainty without doubt and truth without error, it behooves us to place the foundations of knowledge in mathematics." - Roger Bacon

medicine.title: Medicine
medicine.description: "As to diseases make a habit of two things - to help, or at least, to do no harm." - Hippocrates

meditation.title: Meditation
meditation.description: "Meditation brings wisdom; lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back." - The Buddha

metal_casting.title: Metal Casting
metal_casting.description: "And them that take the sword shall perish by the sword." - The Bible, Matthew

military_tradition.title: Military Tradition
military_tradition.description: "Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win." - Sun-Tzu

mining.title: Mining
mining.description: "The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones." - Confucius

monarchy.title: Monarchy
monarchy.description: "A multitude of rulers is not a good thing. Let there be one ruler, one king." - Herodotus

monotheism.title: Monotheism
monotheism.description: "I am the Lord thy God. Thou shalt have no other gods before Me." - The Bible, Exodus

music.title: Music
music.description: "If music be the food of love, play on." - William Shakespeare

mysticism.title: Mysticism
mysticism.description: "Nature herself has imprinted on the minds of all the idea of God." - Cicero

nationalism.title: Nationalism
nationalism.description: "A man does not have himself killed for a half-pence a day or for a petty distinction. You must speak to the soul in order to electrify him." - Napoleon Bonaparte

optics.title: Optics
optics.description: "One doesn't discover new lands without losing sight of the shore." - Andre Gide

paper.title: Paper
paper.description: "I cannot live without books" - Thomas Jefferson

philosophy.title: Philosophy
philosophy.description: "I have gained this by philosophy: that I do without being commanded what others do only from fear of the law." - Aristotle

physics.title: Physics
physics.description: "To every action there is always opposed an equal reaction." - Isaac Newton

plastics.title: Plastics
plastics.description: "I just want to say one word to you. Just one word: plastics." - Calder Willingham, The Graduate

polytheism.title: Polytheism
polytheism.description: "Not at all similar are the race of the immortal gods and the race of men who walk upon the earth." - Homer

pottery.title: Pottery
pottery.description: "Hath not the potter power over the clay, to make one vessel unto honor, and another unto dishonor?" - The Bible, Romans

priesthood.title: Priesthood
priesthood.description: "The Lord bless you and keep you; the Lord make His face to shine upon you and be gracious to you; the Lord lift up His countenance upon you and give you peace." - The Bible, Numbers

printing_press.title: Printing Press
printing_press.description: "What gunpowder did for war, the printing press has done for the mind." - Wendell Phillips

radio.title: Radio
radio.description: "Then one fine mornin' she puts on a New York station. You know her life was saved by Rock 'n' Roll." - The Velvet Underground, "Rock And Roll"

railroad.title: Railroad
railroad.description: "I fooled you, I fooled you, I got pig iron, I got pig iron, I got all pig iron." - Lonnie Donegan, "Rock Island Line"

refrigeration.title: Refrigeration
refrigeration.description: "Tell me what you eat, and I will tell you what you are." - Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

replaceable_parts.title: Replaceable Parts
replaceable_parts.description: "The whole is more than the sum of its parts." - Aristotle

rifling.title: Rifling
rifling.description: "Political power grows out of the barrel of a gun." - Mao Zedong

robotics.title: Robotics
robotics.description: "The real problem is not whether machines think, but whether men do." - B.F. Skinner

rocketry.title: Rocketry
rocketry.description: "The Earth is the cradle of the mind, but one cannot eternally live in a cradle." - Konstantin E. Tsiolkovsky

sailing.title: Sailing
sailing.description: "You can't direct the wind, but you can adjust your sails." - Unknown

scientific_method.title: Scientific Method
scientific_method.description: "I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use." - Galileo Galilei

steam_power.title: Steam Power
steam_power.description: "You would make a ship sail against the winds and currents by lighting a bon-fire under her deck? I have no time for such nonsense." - Napoleon, on Robert Fulton's Steamship

steel.title: Steel
steel.description: "Before that steam drill shall beat me down, I'll die with my hammer in my hand." - from "John Henry, the Steel-Driving Man"

the_wheel.title: The Wheel
the_wheel.description: "Put your shoulder to the wheel." - Aesop

theology.title: Theology
theology.description: "Two cities have been formed by two loves: the earthly by the love of self; the heavenly by the love of God." - St. Augustine

writing.title: Writing
writing.description: "True glory consists in doing what deserves to be written; in writing what deserves to be read." - Pliny the Elder
